result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

3:49 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sonny Bernard Fuggett appeared by video.  Attorney Gerard M Werner appeared by video for Sonny Bernard Fuggett. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing. Email inducement dated 06-08-22.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:37 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sonny B. Fuggett appeared in person.  Attorney Gerard Werner appearing by video for defendant. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 06-17-22 at 3:00 p.m.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of threat to law enforcement officer, disorderly conduct-dvo, criminal damage to property-dvo and battery-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-28-22 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 3.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with K.B.S., DOB: 06-30-199 and O.J.L, DOB: 01-06-2002 and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
